name: Year of Three Popes
summary: 1978 became known as the 'Year of Three Popes' when three different men served as pope within the same year. Pope Paul VI died in August, and Pope John Paul I was elected but died just 33 days later. Cardinal Karol Wojty≈Ça was then elected as Pope John Paul II, the first non-Italian pope in over 450 years and the first Polish pope in history.
